title: Mobile apps helping reduce readmissions
text:
RSS Healthcare IT News , July 16, 2015 
Cynthia Deyling, MD, chief quality officer at Cleveland Clinic, sees burgeoning use of mobile technology at the health system. While emphasizing that, of course, "some readmissions are clinically appropriate and necessary," Deyling says Cleveland Clinic, like so many other hospitals and health systems these days, is putting a focus on "reducing preventable readmissions through improved patient education, follow up, communication and care coordination." Smartphones are playing a big part in helping them get there.
